import java.io.*;
class Occurence {

    int f2(int num){
        int count=0;
        int div=2;
        while(div<=num){
            count+=num/div;
            div*=2;
        }
        return count;
    }
    int f3(int num){
        int count=0;
        int div=3;
        while(div<=num){
            count+=num/div;
            div*=3;
        }
        return count;
    }
    int f5(int num){
        int count=0;
        int div=5;
        while(div<=num){
            count+=num/div;
            div*=5;
        }
        return count;
    }
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
        int t = Integer.parseInt(br.readLine());
        Occurence obj = new Occurence();
        PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(System.out);
        while(t>0){
            int num = Integer.parseInt(br.readLine());
            pw.println(obj.f2(num));
            pw.println(obj.f3(num));
            pw.println(obj.f5(num));
            --t;
        }
        pw.flush();
        // TODO code application logic here
    }
}
